ygData.subject: RE: [eqbards] Newbie bard leaves Kunark (was Newbie bard race to  12 )
ygData.msgSnippet: I can t speak directly for Ill Omen - (I was already too high level when Kunark came out) - but I haven t found anywhere in Kunark where a bard has to worry
ygData.messageBody:
I can't speak directly for Ill Omen - (I was already too high level when
Kunark came out) - but I haven't found anywhere in Kunark where a bard has
to worry about traveling. With Selo's + Drum you can outrun anything. Add
to that they "Forget about you" after a certain distance.

There are a few areas where the accumulation of aggro can be a problem
(wanderer heads your way and attacks you) but that tends to the exception
not the rule.

Slyde 45 of Xegony

-----Original Message-----
From: Elijah Meeker [mailto:emeeker@...]
Sent: Wednesday, July 12, 2000 9:48 AM
To: 'eqbards@egroups.com'
Subject: RE: [eqbards] Newbie bard leaves Kunark (was Newbie bard race
to 12 )


>
> Lake of Ill Omens contains plentiful mobs in all levels from
> level 3-4 thru
> 27-29. You just have to hunt in different regions.
>
> I think that mobs for your level would be just to the right
> of where the
> river hits the lake.

Hrm, maybe it was just a slow spawn night...that run through the
spiders/leaches is pretty scary though, yow. They ARE agro to younuns right?
Not a one attacked me but I figured I was just lucky.
Tsengu


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
